channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Jannik Sinner beats Taylor Fritz to win U.S. Open, weeks after doping exoneration
item.description: No.1-ranked Sinner, of Italy, prevented Taylor Fritz from ending the American major tennis title drought, less than three weeks after word emerged of Sinner's two positive drug tests.
item.content:encoded:
No.1-ranked Sinner, of Italy, prevented Taylor Fritz from ending the American major tennis title drought, less than three weeks after word emerged of Sinner's two positive drug tests.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Mr. Greedy,' a prolific penguin dad, has died at age 33
item.description: Mr. Greedy, a beloved member of the Maryland Zoo, was a prolific breeder who helped boost the endangered African penguin population. He died following an age-related health decline, the zoo said.
item.content:encoded:
Mr. Greedy, a beloved member of the Maryland Zoo, was a prolific breeder who helped boost the endangered African penguin population. He died following an age-related health decline, the zoo said.

(Image credit: Maryland Zoo)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Jazz historian and critic Dan Morgenstern dies at 94
item.description: Over the course of seven decades, Morgenstern helmed major jazz magazines, wrote books, produced concerts, won multiple Grammys, taught college and oversaw one of the world's largest jazz archives.
item.content:encoded:
Over the course of seven decades, Morgenstern helmed major jazz magazines, wrote books, produced concerts, won multiple Grammys, taught college and oversaw one of the world's largest jazz archives.

(Image credit: Infrogmation of New Orleans)
item.dc:creator: Tom Vitale

item.title: Kendrick Lamar will headline next year's Super Bowl halftime show
item.description: The Grammy-winning rapper, who spent this summer topping the charts, previously performed at the 2022 Super Bowl halftime show. But this will be his first Super Bowl as the headliner.
item.content:encoded:
The Grammy-winning rapper, who spent this summer topping the charts, previously performed at the 2022 Super Bowl halftime show. But this will be his first Super Bowl as the headliner.

(Image credit: Amy Harris/Invision/AP)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Women who are blind play a critical role in identifying possible breast cancers
item.description: Dr. Frank Hoffman was appalled by the sheer numbers of cases of early-stage breast cancer that were being missed. Then he had an idea: What if "we were to specially train others to do it."
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Frank Hoffman was appalled by the sheer numbers of cases of early-stage breast cancer that were being missed. Then he had an idea: What if "we were to specially train others to do it."

(Image credit: Smita Sharma for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Kamala Thiagarajan

item.title: 'I am struggling all alone,' says a widowed Ethiopian mother of 6. Now there's hope
item.description: After months of disruption in a massive national feeding effort by global groups, there's a scramble to digitally register more than 6 million Ethiopians to make sure food aid goes to those in need.
item.content:encoded:
After months of disruption in a massive national feeding effort by global groups, there's a scramble to digitally register more than 6 million Ethiopians to make sure food aid goes to those in need.

(Image credit: Ed Kiernan)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Boeing reaches tentative deal with its production workers in hopes to avoid strike
item.description: The union's members still need to vote on Boeing's proposal and decide whether to authorize a strike if the offer is rejected. If that's the case, a walkout could begin as soon as Friday.
item.content:encoded:
The union's members still need to vote on Boeing's proposal and decide whether to authorize a strike if the offer is rejected. If that's the case, a walkout could begin as soon as Friday.

(Image credit: Jason Redmon)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: On the ground in Sudan, an 'apocalyptic' situation
item.description: Fighting in and around Sudan's capital is fierce and devastating to the people who either cannot flee or feel compelled to stay.
item.content:encoded: Fighting in and around Sudan's capital is fierce and devastating to the people who either cannot flee or feel compelled to stay.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: New York City is trying a new solution to its rat problem: trash cans
item.description: New York City has a well known rat problem. And the city is trying to tackle it -- with trash cans and by changing human behavior.
item.content:encoded: New York City has a well known rat problem. And the city is trying to tackle it -- with trash cans and by changing human behavior.
item.dc:creator: Jeongyoon Han

item.title: Mother of Georgia shooting suspect called school to warn of emergency, aunt says
item.description: The mother of the suspect had called the Georgia high school before the fatal shooting of four people, warning staff of an “extreme emergency” involving her son, a relative told the Washington Post.
item.content:encoded:
The mother of the suspect had called the Georgia high school before the fatal shooting of four people, warning staff of an “extreme emergency” involving her son, a relative told the Washington Post.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
